content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia function `clean_column`:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]" => "_")
end
```
In this function, we first convert the string to lower case using the `lowercase` function and then remove any leading or trailing white spaces using the `strip` function. We replace all spaces and hyphens with underscores by replacing regular expressions (`r"[\s-]"`) with an underscore in the `replace` function.
